Package org.bluezoo.gumdrop.ldap.client

Interface LDAPPostTLS

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    LDAPClientConnection
    public interface LDAPPostTLS
    Operations available after STARTTLS upgrade completes.

    This interface is provided to the handler in StartTLSResultHandler.handleTLSEstablished(org.bluezoo.gumdrop.ldap.client.LDAPPostTLS) after a successful STARTTLS extended operation and TLS handshake.

    After TLS is established, the handler should bind to authenticate. Directory operations are not available until binding succeeds.

    Note: STARTTLS cannot be issued again after the connection is already secured, so that method is not available in this interface.

    Author:
    Chris Burdess
    See Also:
    StartTLSResultHandler.handleTLSEstablished(org.bluezoo.gumdrop.ldap.client.LDAPPostTLS), LDAPSession

    • Method Detail

      • bind

        void bind​(java.lang.String dn,
          java.lang.String password,
          BindResultHandler callback)
        Performs a simple bind (authentication) with DN and password.

        Credentials are now protected by TLS. After a successful bind, the handler receives an LDAPSession for performing directory operations.

        Parameters:
        dn - the distinguished name to bind as
        password - the password for authentication
        callback - receives the bind result

      • bindAnonymous

        void bindAnonymous​(BindResultHandler callback)
        Performs an anonymous bind.

        Anonymous binds use empty DN and password. Some servers allow limited operations for anonymous connections.

        Parameters:
        callback - receives the bind result

      • unbind

        void unbind()
        Closes the connection without binding.

        Sends an unbind request and closes the connection.
